channel.title: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian
channel.description:
As I am new to PI sources and Debian VPS's I'd like some one to carefully show me on teamviewer how it's done.
You'll be given lots of love and credit upon release
Add me on msn at:grave-diggers@hotmail.com
Thanks

item.title: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian
item.dc:creator: @Bakpao Bakpao
item.description:
@Bakpao wrote:

Doesn’t work. I tried from the root directory, and inside the server directory and it does nothing.
If one of you knows how to do this with shell scripts, I’ll wipe my VPS and allow you to install it.

Just add me on msn.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian

item.title: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:13, topic:368843”][quote author=Enoclious link=topic=464976.msg3402145#msg3402145 date=1290032396]

Well, I’m not aware of how to load PI on Linux yet.

This would have been my best guess, but I doubt it works.

java -Xmx512m -cp ./bin:/deps/poi.jar:/deps/mysql.jar:/deps/mina.jar:/deps/slf4j.jar:/deps/slf4j-nop.jar:/deps/jython.jar:/log4j-1.2.15.jar server/Server

That should work fine.
[/quote]

I’m not Linux pro but couldn’t you just run the batch in wine? Or use terminal to run it?

I’d appreciate it if you’d reply.[/quote]
[font=times new roman]Yeah if you cd from Terminal to the root directory and use the command he posted it should work. Or just use the shell script…[/font]

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian

Well, I’m not aware of how to load PI on Linux yet.

This would have been my best guess, but I doubt it works.

java -Xmx512m -cp ./bin:/deps/poi.jar:/deps/mysql.jar:/deps/mina.jar:/deps/slf4j.jar:/deps/slf4j-nop.jar:/deps/jython.jar:/log4j-1.2.15.jar server/Server

[/quote]
That should work fine.[/quote]

I’m not Linux pro but couldn’t you just run the batch in wine? Or use terminal to run it?

I’d appreciate it if you’d reply.

item.title: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Then show me the command line code you are using.

I’m not extremely familiar with Mac OS, Linux, Unix, Ubuntu, etc.

Though, is Debian more or less like Linux? If you, you need to use Shell Script, not Batch.

Both Debian and Ubuntu use the Linux kernel.

Does that mean it uses Shell, or Batch, or both?[/quote]
[font=times new roman]It would use shell scripts.[/font]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Setting up a VPS on Debian
item.dc:creator: @Bakpao Bakpao
item.description:
@Bakpao wrote:

I’ve done Ubuntu without VirtualBox. Debian is pretty much the same.

This is what I get when I execute java Server command.
All of my class files are insider /bin/server and the map that holds all the server files is called server.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Server (wrong name: server/Server) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:632) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:616) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) Could not find the main class: Server. Program will exit.

Read full topic
